title: Photoelectric - Kmax vs number of photons per sec

content.question: Monochromatic light is incident on a metal surface, causing electrons to be emitted from the surface. When <math alttext="n sub p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>n</mi><mi>p</mi></msub></mstyle></math> photons per second strike the surface, the emitted electrons have kinetic energies ranging from zero to <math alttext="K sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>. Which of the following correctly describes the maximum kinetic energy <math alttext="K sub max" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>max</mi></msub></mstyle></math> of emitted electrons when <math alttext="2 n sub p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>n</mi><mi>p</mi></msub></mstyle></math> photons per second from the same light source are incident on the same surface?

choices.label: <math alttext="K sub max, end sub, equals K sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>max</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="K sub 0, end sub, is less than, K sub max, end sub, which is less than, 2 K sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>max</mi></msub><mo><</mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>
<math alttext="K sub max, end sub, equals 2 K sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>max</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="K sub max, end sub, is greater than, 2 K sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>max</mi></msub><mo>></mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="K sub max, end sub, equals K sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>max</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
